remarks: The value of the ` gcd ` operator. ` ( M gcd N ) ` is the greatest common divisor of ` M ` and ` N ` .  If ` M ` and ` N ` are both ` 0 ` , the result is defined conventionally as ` 0 ` .  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Mar-2011.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Nov-2013.)
statement:
gcdval $p |- ( ( M e. ZZ /\ N e. ZZ ) -> ( M gcd N ) = if ( ( M = 0 /\ N = 0 ) , 0 , sup ( { n e. ZZ | ( n || M /\ n || N ) } , RR , < ) ) ) $.
$d M n $.
$d N n $.
